{{Infobox sports season | title = 2009â10 Eastern College Athletic Conference women's ice hockey season | caption = #193980 | color = #193980 | color text = #FFFFFF | league = [[NCAA]] Division I | sport = [[Ice hockey]] | logo = | pixels = 125px | caption = | duration = September 2009
through March, 2010 | no_of_teams = | attendance = | TV = | draft = | draft_link = | top_pick = | picked_by = | season = Regular Season | season_champs = Cornell Big Red | season_champ_name= Champion | league_champs = Clarkson Golden Knights | league_champ_name= Runners-Up | second_place = | MVP = Catherine White | MVP_link = ECAC Women's Ice Hockey Player of the Year | top_scorer = | top_scorer_link = | promote = | promoted_from = | relegate = | relegate_to = | playoffs = | playoffs_link = | conf1 = | conf1_link = | conf1_ECACmp = | conf1-runner-up = | conf2 = | conf2_link = | conf2_ECACmp = | conf2-runner-up = | playoffs_MVP = | playoffs_MVP_link= | finals = Tournament | finals_link = 2010 CHA Women's Ice Hockey Tournament | finals_champ = Cornell Big Red | finals_runner-up = Clarkson Golden Knights | finals_MVP = Kendice Ogilvie | finals_MVP_link = Most Valuable Player | seasonslist = | seasonslistnames = Ice hockey | prevseason_year = [[2008-09 Eastern College Athletic Conference women's ice hockey season|08â09]] | nextseason_year = [[2010â11 ECAC women's ice hockey season|10â11]] }} The '''2009â10 [[ECAC women's ice hockey]] season''' marked the continuation of the annual tradition of competitive [[ice hockey]] among [[Eastern College Athletic Conference]] members. ==Pre-season== *September 22: St. Lawrence, which has finished among the top three teams in the regular-season standings each year since 2000-01, has been selected to finish in first place in the ECAC in the preseason poll. The voting was done by the league coaches as part of the pre-season polls and all-league team. The Saints, garnered a total of 107 points, including three of 12 first-place votes.{{cite web|url=http://ecachockey.com/women/2009-10/20092209_W_Pre_Coaches_Poll |title=ECAC Hockey |publisher=ECAC Hockey |date=2009-09-22 |accessdate=2010-05-09}} St. Lawrence, boasts returning all-league selection senior defender Britni Smith. Last season, the team finished second in the regular-season standings with a mark of 16-5-1. Harvard claimed three first-place votes to finish second in the poll. The Crimson earned 103 total points. Harvard is the two-time defending regular-season champion. Dartmouth gained five first place votes, and is slotted to finish third in regular-season play according to the voting. The Big Green compiled 93 points in the poll. Princeton ranks fourth in the preseason poll with 89 points. Clarkson occupies the fifth slot with 85 points, earning one first-place vote. ECAC Hockey Championship runner-up Rensselaer was selected to finish in sixth place, with 74 points. === ECAC pre-season coaches poll=== {| class="wikitable" style="width:80%;" |- style="text-align:center; The finalists were named and include the following players: Sarah Parsons (Dartmouth), Britney Selina (Clarkson), Allison Wright (Rensselaer) and Liz Zorn (Cornell).{{cite web|url=http://www.ecachockey.com/women/2009-10/Weekly_Awards/20100303_W_Best_Def_Forw_Finalists |title=ECAC Hockey |publisher=ECAC Hockey |date=2010-03-03 |accessdate=2010-05-09}} *March 4: Kate Buesser (Harvard), [[Sarah Parsons]] (Dartmouth), Catherine White (Cornell) have been named a finalist for the ECAC Player of the Year Award.{{cite web|url=http://dartmouthsports.com/ViewArticle.dbml?SPSID=48905&SPID=4726&DB_OEM_ID=11600&ATCLID=204901123 |title=Parsons Selected as Finalist for ECAC Hockey Player of the Year - DartmouthSports.comâOfficial Web Site of Dartmouth Varsity Athletics |publisher=Dartmouthsports.com |date= |accessdate=2010-05-09}} *March 4: Lauren Dahm (Clarkson), Amanda Mazzotta (Cornell) and Victoria Vigilanti (Quinnipiac) have been named as finalists for the ECAC Goalie of the Year.{{cite web|url=http://www.ecachockey.com/women/2009-10/Weekly_Awards/20100403_W_Goalie_Finalists |title=ECAC Hockey |publisher=ECAC Hockey |date=2010-03-04 |accessdate=2010-05-09}} *March 5: Laura Gersten (Rensselaer), Sarah Parsons, (Dartmouth) and Randi Griffin (Harvard) are the finalists for the ECAC Student Athlete of the Year.{{cite web|url=http://www.ecachockey.com/women/2009-10/Weekly_Awards/20100503_SA_of_Yr_Finalists |title=ECAC Hockey |publisher=ECAC Hockey |date=2010-03-05 |accessdate=2010-05-09}} {| class="wikitable" |- !
